15#include <config.h>
16
17#include <inttypes.h>
18#include <stdbool.h>
19
20#include <sys/types.h>
21#include <sys/time.h> /* Required on some systems for <sys/resource.h>. */
22#include <sys/resource.h>
23
24#include <isc/platform.h>
25#include <isc/resource.h>
26#include <isc/result.h>
27#include <isc/util.h>
28
29#ifdef __linux__
30#include <linux/fs.h> /* To get the large NR_OPEN. */
31#endif
32
33#include "errno2result.h"
34
35static isc_result_t
36resource2rlim(isc_resource_t resource, int *rlim_resource) {
37 isc_result_t result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
38
39 switch (resource) {
40 case isc_resource_coresize:
41 *rlim_resource = RLIMIT_CORE;
42 break;
43 case isc_resource_cputime:
44 *rlim_resource = RLIMIT_CPU;
45 break;
46 case isc_resource_datasize:
47 *rlim_resource = RLIMIT_DATA;
48 break;
49 case isc_resource_filesize:
50 *rlim_resource = RLIMIT_FSIZE;
51 break;
52 case isc_resource_lockedmemory:
53#ifdef RLIMIT_MEMLOCK
54 *rlim_resource = RLIMIT_MEMLOCK;
55#else
56 result = ISC_R_NOTIMPLEMENTED;
57#endif
58 break;
59 case isc_resource_openfiles:
60#ifdef RLIMIT_NOFILE
61 *rlim_resource = RLIMIT_NOFILE;
62#else
63 result = ISC_R_NOTIMPLEMENTED;
64#endif
65 break;
66 case isc_resource_processes:
67#ifdef RLIMIT_NPROC
68 *rlim_resource = RLIMIT_NPROC;
69#else
70 result = ISC_R_NOTIMPLEMENTED;
71#endif
72 break;
73 case isc_resource_residentsize:
74#ifdef RLIMIT_RSS
75 *rlim_resource = RLIMIT_RSS;
76#else
77 result = ISC_R_NOTIMPLEMENTED;
78#endif
79 break;
80 case isc_resource_stacksize:
81 *rlim_resource = RLIMIT_STACK;
82 break;
83 default:
84 /*
85 * This test is not very robust if isc_resource_t
86 * changes, but generates a clear assertion message.
87 */
88 REQUIRE(resource >= isc_resource_coresize &&
89 resource <= isc_resource_stacksize);
90
91 result = ISC_R_RANGE;
92 break;
93 }
94
95 return (result);
96}
97
98isc_result_t
99isc_resource_setlimit(isc_resource_t resource, isc_resourcevalue_t value) {
100 struct rlimit rl;
101 rlim_t rlim_value;
102 int unixresult;
103 int unixresource;
104 isc_result_t result;
105
106 result = resource2rlim(resource, &unixresource);
107 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
108 return (result);
109
110 if (value == ISC_RESOURCE_UNLIMITED)
111 rlim_value = RLIM_INFINITY;
112
113 else {
114 /*
115 * isc_resourcevalue_t was chosen as an unsigned 64 bit
116 * integer so that it could contain the maximum range of
117 * reasonable values. Unfortunately, this exceeds the typical
118 * range on Unix systems. Ensure the range of
119 * rlim_t is not overflowed.
120 */
121 isc_resourcevalue_t rlim_max;
122 bool rlim_t_is_signed =
123 (((double)(rlim_t)-1) < 0);
124
125 if (rlim_t_is_signed)
126 rlim_max = ~((rlim_t)1 <<
127 (sizeof(rlim_t) * 8 - 1));
128 else
129 rlim_max = (rlim_t)-1;
130
131 if (value > rlim_max)
132 value = rlim_max;
133
134 rlim_value = value;
135 }
136
137 rl.rlim_cur = rl.rlim_max = rlim_value;
138 unixresult = setrlimit(unixresource, &rl);
139
140 if (unixresult == 0)
141 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
142
143#if defined(OPEN_MAX) && defined(__APPLE__)
144 /*
145 * The Darwin kernel doesn't accept RLIM_INFINITY for rlim_cur; the
146 * maximum possible value is OPEN_MAX. BIND8 used to use
147 * sysconf(_SC_OPEN_MAX) for such a case, but this value is much
148 * smaller than OPEN_MAX and is not really effective.
149 */
150 if (resource == isc_resource_openfiles && rlim_value == RLIM_INFINITY) {
151 rl.rlim_cur = OPEN_MAX;
152 unixresult = setrlimit(unixresource, &rl);
153 if (unixresult == 0)
154 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
155 }
156#elif defined(__linux__)
157#ifndef NR_OPEN
158#define NR_OPEN (1024*1024)
159#endif
160
161 /*
162 * Some Linux kernels don't accept RLIM_INFINIT; the maximum
163 * possible value is the NR_OPEN defined in linux/fs.h.
164 */
165 if (resource == isc_resource_openfiles && rlim_value == RLIM_INFINITY) {
166 rl.rlim_cur = rl.rlim_max = NR_OPEN;
167 unixresult = setrlimit(unixresource, &rl);
168 if (unixresult == 0)
169 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
170 }
171#endif
172 if (resource == isc_resource_openfiles && rlim_value == RLIM_INFINITY) {
173 if (getrlimit(unixresource, &rl) == 0) {
174 rl.rlim_cur = rl.rlim_max;
175 unixresult = setrlimit(unixresource, &rl);
176 if (unixresult == 0)
177 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
178 }
179 }
180 return (isc__errno2result(errno));
181}
182
183isc_result_t
184isc_resource_getlimit(isc_resource_t resource, isc_resourcevalue_t *value) {
185 int unixresource;
186 struct rlimit rl;
187 isc_result_t result;
188
189 result = resource2rlim(resource, &unixresource);
190 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
191 return (result);
192 }
193
194 if (getrlimit(unixresource, &rl) != 0) {
195 return (isc__errno2result(errno));
196 }
197
198 *value = rl.rlim_max;
199 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
200}
201
202isc_result_t
203isc_resource_getcurlimit(isc_resource_t resource, isc_resourcevalue_t *value) {
204 int unixresource;
205 struct rlimit rl;
206 isc_result_t result;
207
208 result = resource2rlim(resource, &unixresource);
209 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
210 return (result);
211 }
212
213 if (getrlimit(unixresource, &rl) != 0) {
214 return (isc__errno2result(errno));
215 }
216
217 *value = rl.rlim_cur;
218 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
219}
